Package com.simpleprogrammer.infinitetcp

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.simpleprogrammer.infinitetcp.Server
  • public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
    This class creates a TCP server in which Clients can connect to
    The class uses XML to serialize the data sent

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Server()
      Creates an unbound Server
      Server​(int port)
      Creates a Server bound to the specified port

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addListener​(ServerListener listener)
      Adds a @code ServerListener to the Server to launch the event methods
      void bind​(int port)
      Binds the Server to the specified port
      java.util.ArrayList<Connection> getConnections()
      Returns all the connections currently connected to the Server.
      boolean removeListener​(ServerListener listener)
      Removes the first index of a @code ServerListener from the Server
      void start()
      Starts the Server
      If wanting to run other processes this should be called in a thread as it will run infinitely until the stop() method is invoked
      void stop()
      Starts the Server
      If wanting to run other processes this should be called in a thread as it will run infinitely until the stop() method is invoked

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server​(int port)
        Creates a Server bound to the specified port
        Parameters:
        port - the port to bind the Server to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the port is out of range

      • Server

        public Server()
        Creates an unbound Server

    • Method Detail

      • bind

        public void bind​(int port)
        Binds the Server to the specified port
        Parameters:
        port - the port to bind the server to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the port is out of range

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Starts the Server
        If wanting to run other processes this should be called in a thread as it will run infinitely until the stop() method is invoked
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Server is not bound or has already started
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error has occurred when starting the Server

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Starts the Server
        If wanting to run other processes this should be called in a thread as it will run infinitely until the stop() method is invoked
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the Server has not started
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error has occurred when stopping the Server

      • getConnections

        public java.util.ArrayList<Connection> getConnections()
        Returns all the connections currently connected to the Server.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList holding all the connections to the Server.

      • addListener

        public void addListener​(ServerListener listener)
        Adds a @code ServerListener to the Server to launch the event methods
        Parameters:
        listener - the ServerListener to be added

      • removeListener

        public boolean removeListener​(ServerListener listener)
        Removes the first index of a @code ServerListener from the Server
        Parameters:
        listener - the ServerListener to be removed
        Returns:
        whether or not the ServerListener was removed
